revised_title: Investigation of the Action of Copper Sulphate and Sulphuric Acid on Metallic Copper
tldr: Arthur Schuster investigates the reaction between copper, copper sulphate, and sulphuric acid, concluding that the observed weight loss is primarily due to the presence of oxygen in the solution. He also notes the possible formation of copper sulphide, supported by the release of hydrogen sulfide when the copper is heated in hydrogen after immersion.
